items.title: These maps show why the US is obsessed with Greenland and its Arctic neighbours
items.description: After a week of escalating rhetoric over Greenland, Donald Trump says he has now secured "total access" to the Arctic island. This is why that region is so important.

items.title: Gunman wanted over triple shooting could be difficult to find, police say
items.description: Police have warned residents in villages neighbouring Lake Cargelligo to remain vigilant after three people were shot dead in a domestic violence attack on Thursday.

items.title: Track temperatures live as heatwave sweeps continent
items.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

items.title: Defiant Sussan Ley downplays Nationals' exit, vows to remain leader
items.description: The Liberal leader did not speak about the Nationals' decision to terminate the Coalition on yesterday's National Day of Mourning, but on Friday insisted her focus was on the government.

items.title: Paris Hilton brings sex tape story to Washington for AI porn fight
items.description: The party girl turned anti-abuse advocate throws her glamorous celebrity heft behind a push to tackle deepfake pornography.

items.title: Live: Medvedev pulls off fourth Aus Open miracle as heatwave prompts rescheduling
items.description: Three-time Australian Open runner-up Daniil Medvedev comes back from two sets down to beat Fabian Marozsan, while Australian wildcard pair James McCabe and Li Tu beat the men's doubles top seeds on day six of the Australian Open. Follow live.

items.title: One Nation's rise in popularity changes the context of the Coalition's divorce
items.description: It is impossible to view this week’s events without the broader context of the relationship between the Liberals and the Nationals, how the electoral map is changing and what that means for right-wing politics in Australia.

items.title: Albanese predicts 'at least one more' Coalition MP will defect to One Nation — as it happened
items.description: The PM's comments came after Nationals leader David Littleproud said he was open to working with Liberal leader Sussan Ley again "at some point", but right now the two parties need "a bit of time apart".

items.title: TikTok finalises deal to form new American version of app
items.description: Social media giant TikTok reaches a deal for a new joint venture in the United States to avoid being banned for American users. The platform's Beijing-based parent company, ByteDance, will retain a 19.9 per cent stake in the company.

items.title: Venezuela once built a retail mecca. Then it became a notorious 'torture prison'
items.description: Nestled among shanty homes, mountains and forestry, a giant building once touted to become Venezuela's world-leading retail mecca later turned into a centre for alleged human rights abuses.

items.title: What is a landslide and how does it happen?
items.description: Two people have died after a landslide hit their home in New Zealand and authorities are searching for several others feared dead in another slip nearby. Here's how landslides occur, the warning signs and where they are most common.

items.title: Neo-Nazi leader's words too extreme for many in March for Australia crowd
items.description: With the organisers of March for Australia rallies saying they "are in no way concerned by the presence" of members of the National Socialist Network, the ABC can confirm a Tasmanian man whose words were too extreme for many in the Hobart crowd is believed to be a leader within the state's Neo-Nazi movement.

items.title: Labor identity Tim Picton remembered at memorial service
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among political figures and business leaders who travel across the country to pay their respects to Mr Picton.

items.title: US officials reveal multi-billion-dollar Gaza rebuild plans
items.description: US officials have presented their vision for a "New Gaza" that would turn the shattered Palestinian territory into a glitzy resort of skyscrapers by the sea.

items.title: Live: ASX slightly up, Aussie dollar hits 15-month high, gold breaches $US4,900
items.description: The Australian share market has finished slightly higher after a rally on Wall Street, as investors showed signs of relief a day after US President Donald Trump dropped tariff threats against eight European countries and ruled out seizing Greenland by force. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

items.title: Aussies soar, Wicked gone for good and other Oscar nomination surprises and snubs
items.description: Hybrid horror Sinners came up as the big winner in the 98th Academy Award nominations, with Aussie actors also eyeing up gold, and Wicked: For Good wiped off the map.

items.title: British Australians confused, frustrated by new UK entry rules
items.description: Confused dual citizens are voicing their frustrations as they grapple with changes to the UK's entry requirements, which roll out next month.

items.title: Brisbane 'cake swap' event under investigation after safety complaints
items.description: An investigation has been launched into a viral Brisbane 'cake swap' event after attendees raised concerns over food safety and hygiene, with cakes reportedly left uncovered in hot weather for hours.

items.title: Weekly news quiz: A political break-up, a fashionable entrance and Macron's aviators
items.description: Another week, another quiz. Are you ready to test yourself?

items.title: 'I am being censored': Councillor sanctioned over 'clown man' comments
items.description: A Tasmanian councillor says she is being "censored and unfairly punished" after being sanctioned for social media posts she made regarding a fellow councillor.

items.title: ICE officers detain boy, 5, as he arrives home from preschool in Minnesota
items.description: School officials and the family's lawyer say the boy and his father were taken to a detention facility in Texas, making the boy the fourth student from Minneapolis detained by immigration officers in recent weeks.

items.title: Cleaners in hazmat suits called to op shop after 'abhorrent' donation
items.description: The future of a Victorian op shop is in doubt after a worker opened a bag containing the stuff of nightmares, leading to the destruction of stock and hefty cleaning bills that may prove to be a deadly financial blow.

items.title: Townsville woman says she warned authorities before suspected drownings
items.description: Local mother Jordan Pryce says she witnessed multiple near-drownings at the swimming hole on Sunday.

items.title: Meet the 15yo Melbourne schoolgirl who has taken the Freeski world by storm
items.description: When 15-year-old Indra Brown reached the podium in her first World Cup event, she needed help from global superstar Eileen Gu to pop the cork on her champagne. She's had plenty more practice since, as she heads into the Milan Cortina 2026 Winter Olympic Games.

items.title: 'Abhorrent' letter threatening violence on Australia Day investigated by police
items.description: The note, seen by the ABC, incited violence against several groups, including Middle Eastern communities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and a number of political figures from Labor, the Greens and "socialists" were also singled out.
